name: Case Study Module
description: Three-part bordered container presenting a challenge/solution/result narrative structure, with subtle left-border accent and consistent internal typography for evidence-based storytelling.
components: Module title: $heading-04 for the case study name or client reference
Result section: $heading-04 label + $body-long-01 content with optional inline metric
Left border accent: 4px solid $blue-60 spanning full module height
Optional result metric: $heading-02 in $blue-60 for a key outcome number
rules: Three-part structure is mandatory: Challenge, Solution, Result — all three must be present
Left border accent is 4px solid $blue-60, spanning the full height of the module
Section labels (Challenge/Solution/Result) use $heading-04 with $spacing-06 gap before content
Body content uses $body-long-01 for comfortable reading — each section is 1-2 paragraphs max
Vertical spacing between the three sections is $spacing-06 (24px) with a subtle $ui-03 divider line
Optional result metric uses $heading-02 in $blue-60 to quantify the outcome
Internal padding is $spacing-07 (32px) on all sides, with $spacing-05 extra left padding to clear the accent border
Maximum 3 case study modules per document — more should be moved to an appendix
antiPatterns: Never omit one of the three sections (challenge/solution/result) — incomplete case studies undermine credibility
Never use full-width (colSpan 16) — the offset and border-left need spatial context to look intentional
Never include charts or data tables inside a case study module — keep it narrative-focused; place data adjacent
Never exceed 3 case study modules in one document — consolidate or move extras to an appendix
Never use a border color other than $blue-60 for the left accent — brand consistency requires the primary blue
